titles: A reply to a paper of Dr. Sandersons, containing a censure of Mr. A.A. his booke Of the confusions and revolutions of goverment [sic]
author: Sanderson, Robert, 1587-1663.
publisher: Printed by A.J., and are to be sold by T.R.,
notes: A reply, not only to Sanderson, but also to Edward Gee's "An exercitation concerning usurped powers", another reply to Antony Ascham's work.
Includes "Dr Sandersons paper and censure", beginning: Upon persual [sic] Mr. Ascham's book you left with mee, prelim. p. [3]-[4].
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
keywords: Gee, Edward, 1613-1660. --  Exercitation concerning usurped powers.
Ascham, Antony, d. 1650. --  Discourse wherein is examined, what is particularly lawfull during the confusions and revolutions of government.
